action.reasoning: This is a low-value test fixture snapshot from the Babel plugin test suite, not intended as user documentation. It fragments the docs with hyper-specific error examples that add no unique explanatory value. Similar fixtures exist across the test directory, creating massive redundancy. Deleting it reduces file count without information loss; consolidate patterns into a single high-level 'React Compiler Errors Reference' guide in troubleshooting category if needed.

analysis.content_summary: This document captures a test fixture for the React Compiler Babel plugin, showing input JavaScript code that triggers an error for calling a capitalized method (someGlobal.SomeFunc()) inside a React component, along with the exact error message output. It demonstrates the compiler's validation rule against capitalized non-JSX calls.
analysis.primary_topic: React Compiler error: Capitalized method calls in components

action.reasoning: This is a tiny, fragmented test fixture documenting one specific React Compiler error. frontmatter.title: React Compiler Errors Reference
frontmatter.description: Comprehensive guide to all React Compiler error messages, with code examples, explanations, causes, and fixes. Covers diagnostics like ref capture, invalid calls, and more from babel-plugin-react-compiler tests.
prerequisites: Familiarity with React 19 and Compiler setup

action.reasoning: This is one of many fragmented test fixture snapshots for React Compiler errors (__tests__/fixtures/compiler/error.*.expect.md). They are low-value as individual docs, highly redundant in format, and better consolidated into a single comprehensive 'React Compiler Errors Reference' document listing common errors, inputs, and messages with explanations. This reduces file count dramatically, improves navigability, and creates a useful reference for developers encountering compiler errors. Delete originals after merge.

analysis.content_summary: This document captures a snapshot test fixture for the React Compiler Babel plugin, demonstrating an error case where a function expression within a React component reassigns the variable it is assigned to (callback = null inside its own definition). It includes the input JavaScript code and the expected compiler error message about reassigning variables after render completes.
analysis.primary_topic: React Compiler error handling for variable reassignment in function expressions
quality_issues: Not user-facing documentation; it's an internal test fixture snapshot
Extremely narrow scope (single error case)
Lacks context, explanations, or guidance for users
Poor structure for documentation purposes
Redundant if similar error fixtures exist

frontmatter.title: React Compiler Error: Function Expression References Variable It's Assigned To
frontmatter.description: Example of React Compiler error triggered by reassigning a variable (e.g., callback) within its own function expression definition inside a component, advising use of state instead. Part of compiler test fixtures; recommend consolidation into errors reference.
frontmatter.author: React Team
prerequisites: Familiarity with React Compiler and Babel plugins

analysis.content_summary: Test fixture for React Compiler demonstrating an error case where a hook is attached as a property to another hook function and then loaded/called as a value, violating React's hook rules. analysis.primary_topic: React Compiler error: Hooks may not be referenced as normal values
